# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_internal/models/wheel.py
@source-hash: 39d73535558be4df
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:59:28Z

## Purpose
Represents Python wheel files and provides parsing/validation of wheel filenames according to PEP 425 standards. Core model for wheel compatibility checking in pip's internal package resolution system.

## Key Classes

### Wheel (L13-93)
Primary class representing a parsed wheel file with extracted metadata components.

**Key Attributes:**
- `filename` (L30): Original wheel filename
- `name` (L31): Package name with underscores normalized to hyphens  
- `version` (L34): Package version with underscores normalized to hyphens
- `build_tag` (L35): Optional build tag component
- `pyversions` (L36): List of supported Python versions
- `abis` (L37): List of supported ABI tags
- `plats` (L38): List of supported platform tags
- `file_tags` (L41-43): Set of all Tag combinations from wheel components

**Key Methods:**
- `__init__(filename)` (L23-43): Parses wheel filename using regex, raises InvalidWheelFilename on invalid names
- `get_formatted_file_tags()` (L45-47): Returns sorted string representation of all wheel tags
- `support_index_min(tags)` (L49-65): Finds lowest index of wheel's tags in preference-ordered tag list
- `find_most_preferred_tag(tags, tag_to_priority)` (L67-86): Returns priority of most preferred matching tag using priority mapping
- `supported(tags)` (L88-93): Boolean check if wheel is compatible with any given tags

## Dependencies
- `pip._vendor.packaging.tags.Tag`: External packaging library for tag representation
- `pip._internal.exceptions.InvalidWheelFilename`: Internal exception for validation failures

## Architecture Patterns
- **Regex-based parsing**: Uses verbose regex pattern (L16-21) to extract wheel filename components
- **Tag compatibility system**: Generates all possible tag combinations for comprehensive compatibility checking
- **Normalization strategy**: Converts underscores to hyphens following wheel naming conventions
- **Performance optimization**: `find_most_preferred_tag()` uses priority mapping to avoid linear scans

## Critical Invariants
- Wheel filename must match PEP 425 format or construction fails
- All tag components are split on dots and cross-multiplied to generate complete tag set
- Tag preference is determined by either list position (lower index = higher preference) or explicit priority mapping (lower value = higher preference)
